QuestionList.question: Communicates to employees how their jobs/ works/ goals relate to organizational goals
Keeps open and regular communication with others.
Delivers clear and concise instructions.
Communications with department leadership
Is an effective communicator
Delivers difficult/sensitive messages to co-workers in an appropriate manner
Gets the job done.
Makes effective decisions, even when under pressure.
Works quickly when faced with difficult problems.
Motivates others to achieve or exceed goals
Exhibits personal ambition and drive.
Takes corrective action when necessary.
Maintains control of their bearing and personal appearance.
Does not allow own emotions to interfere with the performance of others.
Sets an example for others during stressful periods by maintaining a positive, can-do attitude.
Able to handle unexpected events and issues.
Does not act impulsively.
Uses patience and self-control in working with customers and associates.
Pursues self-improvement through continual learning.
Grasps new ideas, concepts, technical, or business knowledge.
Shares best practices with others and learns from others.
Sets relevant learning objectives and goals.
Builds onto their strengths.
Demonstrates enthusiasm and a willingness to learn new skills and knowledge
Seeks opportunities for professional development.
Allows employees to fully participate in employee training and professional development.
Encourages employees to advance their education.
Encourages employees to take courses relevant to their job.
Is confident in the decisions they make.
Takes charge when in charge.
Effectively prioritizes and organizes themselves and their workload.
Make sound and timely decisions under pressure
Systematically gathers, analyzes, and interprets information from a variety of sources
Solicits feedback from others on the quality of his/her decision-making
Implements best practice methods within [Company].
Generates innovative and practical ideas and approaches.
Creates innovative solutions to critical problems facing [Company].
Pursues innovative approaches to the current policies and procedures.
Focuses on creating new value for our products/services.
Challenges assumptions about the way things work.
Effective in dealing with ambiguous and challenging situations.
Facilitates others in the development and implementation of changes.
Adopts changes to set and example for others to follow.
Addresses organizational and departmental resistance to changes.
Plans and initiates effective departmental and organizational changes.
Helps others when free-time is available.
Demonstrates the personal confidence to "stay the course," even when faced with difficulty
Sets challenging personal and organizational goals.
Encourages a high-energy, fun work environment and coaches others on how to do the same
Accomplishes difficult tasks obtaining measurable results.
Exhibits high energy and a positive attitude on the job with others
Encourages others to accept projects or tasks that extend their abilities and present opportunities for development.
Assigns tasks and responsibilities to develop skills of others.
Motivates employees to participate in development programs.
Makes sure that employees are aware of how they perform in their job.
Recognizes and celebrates accomplishments of others.
Is aware of the career development goals of subordinates.
Coaches/mentors individuals outside of direct team for performance improvement and to help them be effective coaches for others
Gives others development opportunities through project assignments and increased job responsibilities
Sets and clearly communicates expectations, performance goals, and measurements to others
Teaches Situational Leadership principles to team members
Writes performance reviews based upon facts and demonstrated behaviors
Provides specific, timely, meaningful feedback for Supervisor team when performance is substandard, pointing out deficiencies as they occur
Encourages collaboration with other departments.
Coaches team members to work toward a common goal.
Identifies and resolves conflicts within the team to increase team effectiveness
Provides assistance and support to other team members when needed
Seeks and listens to other's contributions
Facilitates the development of team/unit work standards
Recognizes and respects the contributions and needs of each individual.
Fosters respect and understanding among team members
Recognizes team members who offer a significant contribution to a project.
Offers recognition that is proportional to the accomplishment.
Compliments other people when they do good work
Develops recognition events that reward and motivate others.
Lets employees know when they have done well
Implements formal and informal recognition practices within the department.
Inspires a shared culture by keeping employees informed and working together.
Inspires, encourages, and guides others toward the vision, mission, and goals.
Doesn't show discouragement when facing setbacks.
Runs efficient and effective meetings with agendas, action items, and accountabilities clearly spelled out
Empowers others to achieve results and holds them accountable for actions.
Influences the decisions made at [Company].
Motivates others to reach and exceed organizational goals and objectives.
Coaches others and prepares them for current and future business demands.
Gives direct, constructive, and actionable feedback.
Provides challenging assignments to employees.
Recognizes and rewards employees for their accomplishments.
Aligns manpower, designs work, an allocates tasks to achieve goals.
Demonstrates effective leadership talent and skills
Keep staff informed about what is happening in [Company].
Applies disciplinary measures without favoritism.
Deliver effective feedback on a regular basis
Inspires, encourages, and guides others toward the vision, mission, and goals.
Allocates as much time as needed for task completion.
Obtains commitment from employees regarding completion of tasks.
Measures performance against goals and objectives.
Sets specific and measurable goals for others and follows through to completion.
Prioritizes the work of others.
Is consistent in disciplinary/corrective actions.
Uses timely and appropriate corrective/disciplinary actions.
Effective in performing his/her job.
Encourages others to increase their job performance.
Meets regularly to discuss job performance.
Uses relevant facts to measure & track progress toward achievement of individual & team goals
Sets high goals and strives to meet them.
Displays organizational savvy; knows who to contact in order to get things done.
Understands the vision of [Company] and promotes it ahead of any self-interests.
Communicates a vision of where [Company] needs to be in the future.
Motivates employees to do things in a new way.
